oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Excerpt 3 from oral history interview with Gilbert S. Fox, 2004 March 01
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An excerpt from an oral history interview with Gilbert S. Fox, conducted on 1 March 2004 by Robert P. Richardson as part of the Nashville Public Library's Veterans History Project. Fox, an Executive Officer on board LSM-80 in the US Navy during World War II, discusses the most frightening experiences during his naval service, including his ship being on fire and being attacked by kamikaze pilots. The complete interview, as well as a transcript, is available in the repository.
